holidays.name: National Kindergarten Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the joy and importance of kindergarten education, recognizing the place where many children take their first steps into formal learning and socialization.
holidays.origin: Created to honor the first public kindergarten established in the United States by Margarethe Schurz in 1856.
holidays.funFact: Kindergarten means 'children's garden' in German, emphasizing the nurturing environment for early childhood development.

holidays.name: Silly Day
holidays.description: An unofficial day dedicated to being silly, letting go of inhibitions, and having fun through goofy behavior, jokes, and playful antics.
holidays.origin: Emerges from the human desire to lighten the mood and embrace humor, with no formal founding date.
holidays.funFact: On Silly Day, some people wear mismatched clothes or speak in silly accents just to spread laughter.

holidays.name: Hemingway Day
holidays.description: Honoring the birthday of Ernest Hemingway, this day celebrates the life and works of the iconic American novelist and journalist.
holidays.origin: Commemorates Hemingway‚Äôs birth on July 21, but some regions celebrate on different days in April relating to his events or legacy.
holidays.funFact: Hemingway was known for his adventurous lifestyle and won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1954.

holidays.name: Environmental Awareness Day
holidays.description: A day to promote awareness about the environment, encouraging people to take action in protecting nature and promoting sustainability.
holidays.origin: Developed by environmental organizations to inspire proactive attitudes toward planet health.
holidays.funFact: Many communities organize tree planting and clean-up activities on this day to make a tangible difference.

holidays.name: National Tea Day (UK)
holidays.description: Celebrates the British tradition of tea drinking, honoring all things related to tea‚Äîfrom brewing to sipping with biscuits!
holidays.origin: Started by teaware companies and enthusiasts in the UK to preserve and celebrate tea culture.
holidays.funFact: Tea is the most consumed beverage worldwide after water, and National Tea Day has events featuring everything from tea tastings to afternoon tea parties.
